title.bibl: Lietuva, July 14, 1916. Englewood Lithuanians Donate More Money for War Relief

notesStmt.note: Transcribed from digital images contributed to the Internet Archive by the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.

sourceDesc.bibl: Chicago Foreign Language Press Survey, 1936-1941, Works Projects Administration, Chicago Public Library Omnibus Project

revisionDesc.change: Initial TEI transcription from PanGeo Partners, Inc.

div.bibl: Lietuva, July 14, 1916. ENGLEWOOD LITHUANIANS DONATE MORE MONEY FOR WAR RELIEF

body.p: The South Englewood branch of the Lithuanian Relief and Autonomy Fund has been unceasingly active in its efforts to raise as much money for the Fund as possible. This small Lithuanian colony has already raised about five hundred dollars toward this end.

The directors of the local branch of the Fund held a meeting during the latter part of June. The secretary in his financial report stated that the income of the branch from December, 1915 to June 15, 1916 was as follows:

row.cell: Lodge 182 of the Lithuanian Alliance of America
Proceeds from public meeting of local Lithuanian parish
Proceeds from benefit affair sponsored by Branch 65 of the Lovers of the Fatherland Society
Proceeds from a bazaar sponsored by the Committee of Lithuanian Societies of Englewood
Balance in treasury prior to December, 1915

body.p: After hearing the report made by Secretary B. Janulis, the directors decided to send $125 to the Lithuanian Relief and Autonomy Fund, $25 of which was designated for the autonomy section of the Fund. Thus, the balance which still remains in the treasury of the branch is $25.47 (sic).
